PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Online Intelligence Gathering and Analytics tool
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
An analytics tool to get public opinions on keywords. This was achieved by crawling social media Twitter. Analysed the tweets through python ML libraries. Added location-based filter and graphs and heat maps to visualize the result. 
Also worked on an Android app to monitor the notifications on the phone and hence accessing possible threats and trends through text messages and emails

Presented this solution to Defense Ministry at Smart India Hackathon Finale 2017

Technology Stack:
Python, Django, Python ML SDKs, Javascript, Google APIs, Twitter APIs, Android

Sparrow is an open-source AI-enabled platform that serves as a one-stop enabler of medical and psychological well-being during and after disasters. For users, Sparrow is a conversational AI that is easily accessible through any device, any existing applications, with or without internet connectivity. Sparrow acts as the user's single point of connection with all applications, communication platforms, doctors, and more.

The ubiquitous nature of Sparrow ensures that connectivity, medical help, medical records, updates and alerts are always accessible!

Awards: AngelHack Global Hackathon IBM Challenge Winner 2019, IBM Call for Code Regional Finalists

Framework to deploy and manage e-commerce apps

A dynamic solution that can be customized for/by any shop/restaurant.
Created an android application framework with Admin app and user app. The admin app can dynamically customize content for user app (like a menu, costs, images, etc). Admin app can send notifications(with user category filters), set offers, create coupon codes,etc. There is also an order status tracking feature in the framework. A ready to use solution for any restaurant to enter into online food ordering market, with minimum hard-coded customization required. Includes PayTM integration as payment gateway.

Usecases:
1. Connecti - Artisan discovery platform for rural India
Ecommerce and skill discovery platform to connect Artisans and skilled labour in rural Rajasthan with potential market. Built over Rajasthan state government's Bhamashah and eMitra systems. Presented this solution at the Rajasthan state government IT day.

Technology stack:
Android, FirebaseCloudMessaging, PHP, PayTM APIs, MongoDB, MySQL

Blockchain-based peer to peer insurance platform. Insurebits is an American startup working on providing mobile insurance.
Created android application with a chatbot based user interface and multiple background services that enable capture of phone status and statistics. Built NodeJS for the server-side backend to capture data from Android and connect with the Ethereum blockchain.

Technology Stack:
Android, NodeJS, Ethereum

An end to end Industry IoT platform

UI based IoT application deployment with auto-generating code and automatic big data ready server configuration.
Highly available, reliable and supports real-time data analytics.

Some Features:
*Real-time rules engine
*Time-based rules
*Device management
*Device monitoring
*Real-time alerts
*Multi-protocol support
*Security, access control 
*Graphical data visualization
*Remote Device control
*SDKs for various hardware platforms (Arduino, Embedded C, Python, Node JS)
*Web-API calls
*Simple dashboard to monitor and manage device and data
*Emails, SMS, REST APIs and multiple user interfaces supported
*Edge analytics and intelligence configurable through a dashboard
*True edge learning ability for real-time decisions

Deploy end to end IoT solutions within minutes, without coding at all!

Technology stack:
Apache Kafka, Apache Spark Streaming, MongoDB, Erlang MQTT, Node red, Embedded C
SDKs for multiple platforms and languages

A project in the Health Care sector. Orola is a platform which allows private medical practitioners and laboratories to register themselves. A user can use the android app and look for available doctors and book an appointment. 
Users can apply various filters based on location, speciality, cost and popularity. Orola also maintains an EMR (Electronic Medical Records) of its user and is readily available to the concerned doctor in the future for proper diagnosis. The Android app also has features of reminding the users about dosages and uploading/viewing medical records.

Technology Stack:
Android, MEAN Stack, Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM)

Mini Projects during the BTech curriculum

Trending Hashtags using Apache Spark - Cloud and Big Data (Sem 7)
Used Apache Spark Streaming to analyse the tweets RDDs and find the trending hashtags over a time window by running Spark SQL queries on it. The dynamic graphical representation is shown of the top trending hashtags.
Technology Stack: Scala, Apache Spark Streaming, RDDs, Python matplotlib for graphs

Videocorum - Software Engineering Project (Sem 6)
A cross-OS python media player to play video files with offline subtitle generation. Subtitles are generated without internet connectivity on the device and saved. Handled syncing of subtitles and all other basic video player functionalities
Technology Stack: Python, Speech Recognition libraries, Audio extraction libraries

Bill Split - DBMS Project (Sem 5)
Bill Split is an Android application that is expenditure settlement and management app. A user can create groups and add expense to it. The app handles the money circle and auto-suggests the settlement scheme among individuals of the group to minimize settlement transactions
Technology Stack: Android, PHP, MySQL

AndroController- Programming Laboratory Project (Sem 4)
Simulating a computer’s keyboard with an Android device. Used various android sensor events/gestures as inputs which can be mapped to a keyboard event. Developed an Android app and Python desktop application for the same. 
Technology Stack: Android, Python, Win API libraries, Basic Networking

Speech Recognition in C - DSA Project (Sem 3)
Understood speech recognition concept and tried to implement it in C language. Used FFT and other math libraries in C to convert and compare the input voice signal. With a limited set of words, the program was configured to recognise.
Technology Stack: C, FFT library in C

Every product development starts with idea conceptualization and design. The ideators’ and designers’ first choice is sketching the idea to conceptualize the product. After a few iterations of product design mockups/prototypes are passed on to developers who have the job to convert these designs into a functional product by grasping the design concepts and using their coding skills. Work stops whenever one discipline finishes a portion of the project and passes responsibility to another discipline.

SketchX is a system that understands what a designer has drawn on a whiteboard and can translate that understanding to HTML code. This way we can generate HTML wireframes directly from a hand-drawn image giving an instant working design implementation thus streamlining the design process.
The steps to be performed by the user will be:
1. Draw a sketch of design on the whiteboard/paper
2. Capture an image of sketch
3. Upload the image to a web service
4. Download functional, bootstrap code for the sketch
The product aims to provide these features in the form of web service for ease of accessibility and all the computational requirement to generate the output being handled by our server. This will bridge the gap between design and development process making it more robust.

Technology Stack:
Vision Model: Object Detection Algorithm  (YOLO, RCNN, Faster RCNN), Google OCR Engine, OpenCV, CNNs
Service: MEAN Stack
Code generation: Flexbox, Python
